fields.summary: Provide ability to define all primaries on one server and secondaries on the other

fields.summary: Error modifying service state in HA

comments.body: need to determine if this fix is slated for 3.3.1

The fix for this issue is a modification to the TGTWrapper utility class to ensure that the executor is restarted if stopped when a (local) storage component stops. The fix is well contained and the test case is clear (see previous comment)

Do we want this fix to go into 3.4 or 3.3.1?

I forgot to wait for a decision and merged to 3.3.1, but at least you can now review the change on github:

  https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucalyptus/commit/e6872e0032eef871d9be021277905dbae361afc0

(if not for 3.3.1 I'll revert the commit)

[~sjones]

Lets leave it in. What is the regression area?
The reproduction is as per above, regression testing should cover storage functionality that uses tgtadm / tgtd.

Tested on non-HA, as Steve mentioned in the comment above,
{noformat}
[root@b-11 ~]# euca-describe-services | grep SC_11
SERVICE	storage        	PARTI00        	SC_11          	ENABLED   	58  	http://10.111.1.11:8773/services/Storage	arn:euca:eucalyptus:PARTI00:storage:SC_11/
[root@b-11 ~]# euca-modify-service -s STOPPED SC_11
RESPONSE true
[root@b-11 ~]# euca-describe-services | grep SC_11
SERVICE	storage        	PARTI00        	SC_11          	STOPPED   	59  	http://10.111.1.11:8773/services/Storage	arn:euca:eucalyptus:PARTI00:storage:SC_11/
[root@b-11 ~]# euca-modify-service -s DISABLED SC_11
RESPONSE true
[root@b-11 ~]# euca-describe-services | grep SC_11
SERVICE	storage        	PARTI00        	SC_11          	DISABLED  	59  	http://10.111.1.11:8773/services/Storage	arn:euca:eucalyptus:PARTI00:storage:SC_11/
{noformat}

Hi [~sjones],

What is the expected behavior for the fix? Is it only to avoid that particular error by using {{getExecutor}} or {{getExecutorWithInit}}?

I found the following during test:

after disabling the SC service, it is going to ENABLED state after few seconds,
{noformat}
[root@b-11 ~]# euca-modify-service -s DISABLED SC_11
RESPONSE true
[root@b-11 ~]# euca-describe-services | grep SC_11
SERVICE	storage        	PARTI00        	SC_11          	DISABLED  	37  	http://10.111.1.11:8773/services/Storage	arn:euca:eucalyptus:PARTI00:storage:SC_11/
[root@b-11 ~]# euca-describe-services | grep SC_11
SERVICE	storage        	PARTI00        	SC_11          	DISABLED  	37  	http://10.111.1.11:8773/services/Storage	arn:euca:eucalyptus:PARTI00:storage:SC_11/
[root@b-11 ~]# euca-describe-services | grep SC_11
SERVICE	storage        	PARTI00        	SC_11          	DISABLED  	37  	http://10.111.1.11:8773/services/Storage	arn:euca:eucalyptus:PARTI00:storage:SC_11/
[root@b-11 ~]# euca-describe-services | grep SC_11
SERVICE	storage        	PARTI00        	SC_11          	ENABLED   	38  	http://10.111.1.11:8773/services/Storage	arn:euca:eucalyptus:PARTI00:storage:SC_11/
[root@b-11 ~]# euca-describe-services | grep SC_11
SERVICE	storage        	PARTI00        	SC_11          	ENABLED   	38  	http://10.111.1.11:8773/services/Storage	arn:euca:eucalyptus:PARTI00:storage:SC_11/
{noformat}

When concurrent state transition were requested,
{noformat}
[root@b-11 ~]# euca-modify-service -s STOPPED SC_11 ; euca-modify-service -s ENABLED SC_11 ; euca-modify-service -s DISABLED SC_11
RESPONSE true
Error(400 Bad Request): java.util.concurrent.ExecutionException: com.eucalyptus.util.fsm.ExistingTransitionException: Transition request state=DISABLED rejected because of an ongoing transition: State:name=arn:euca:eucalyptus:PARTI00:storage:SC_11/:state=NOTREADY:mark=true:transition=TRANSITION arn:euca:eucalyptus:PARTI00:storage:SC_11/ #8252 READY_CHECK ActiveTransition name=READY_CHECK from=NOTREADY/false to=DISABLED/false error=NOTREADY action=CHECK id=8252 startTime=Wed Jul 17 05:08:31 PDT 2013
RESPONSE true
{noformat}

Again from ENABLED state,
{noformat}
[root@b-11 ~]# euca-modify-service -s STOPPED SC_11 ; euca-modify-service -s ENABLED SC_11 ; euca-modify-service -s DISABLED SC_11
RESPONSE true
RESPONSE true
Error(400 Bad Request): com.eucalyptus.util.fsm.ExistingTransitionException: Transition request state=DISABLED rejected because of an ongoing transition: State:name=arn:euca:eucalyptus:PARTI00:storage:SC_11/:state=ENABLED:mark=true:transition=TRANSITION arn:euca:eucalyptus:PARTI00:storage:SC_11/ #9838 ENABLED_CHECK ActiveTransition name=ENABLED_CHECK from=ENABLED/false to=ENABLED/false error=NOTREADY action=CHECK id=9838 startTime=Wed Jul 17 05:21:23 PDT 2013
{noformat}

Trying to stop and disabled,
{noformat}
[root@b-11 ~]# euca-modify-service -s STOPPED SC_11 ; euca-modify-service -s DISABLED SC_11
RESPONSE true
Error(400 Bad Request): java.util.concurrent.ExecutionException: java.util.NoSuchElementException: No transition to NOTREADY from current state State:name=arn:euca:eucalyptus:PARTI00:storage:SC_11/:state=NOTREADY:mark=false:transition=idle. Known transitions: [Transition name=REMOVING from=STOPPED/false to=PRIMORDIAL/false error=BROKEN action=DESTROY, Transition name=DISABLED_CHECK from=DISABLED/false to=DISABLED/false error=NOTREADY action=CHECK, Transition name=START from=LOADED/false to=NOTREADY/false error=BROKEN action=START, Transition name=FAILED_TO_PREPARE from=PRIMORDIAL/false to=BROKEN/false error=BROKEN action=TransitionAction.noop, Transition name=STOPPING_BROKEN from=BROKEN/false to=STOPPED/false error=BROKEN action=TransitionAction.noop, Transition name=DISABLE from=ENABLED/false to=DISABLED/false error=NOTREADY action=DISABLE, Transition name=DESTROY from=STOPPED/false to=INITIALIZED/false error=BROKEN action=TransitionAction.noop, Transition name=STOPPING_NOTREADY from=NOTREADY/false to=STOPPED/false error=NOTREADY action=STOP, Transition name=INITIALIZING from=PRIMORDIAL/false to=INITIALIZED/false error=BROKEN action=TransitionAction.noop, Transition name=ENABLED_CHECK from=ENABLED/false to=ENABLED/false error=NOTREADY action=CHECK, Transition name=LOAD from=INITIALIZED/false to=LOADED/false error=BROKEN action=LOAD, Transition name=STOP from=DISABLED/false to=STOPPED/false error=NOTREADY action=STOP, Transition name=RELOAD from=BROKEN/false to=INITIALIZED/false error=BROKEN action=TransitionAction.noop, Transition name=READY_CHECK from=NOTREADY/false to=DISABLED/false error=NOTREADY action=CHECK, Transition name=ENABLE from=DISABLED/false to=ENABLED/false error=NOTREADY action=ENABLE]
{noformat}

[~mdshaonimran], note that setting a service state to DISABLED doesn't stop the service, in an HA config, it should then choose a component to go to ENABLED, it may (likely) choose the component that was most recently DISABLED.  So that part is expected behavior.

You should be able to set it to STOPPED.
[~shaon] the expected behaviour is that the service moves to DISABLED without an error (and may then move to ENABLED)

Was able to disable service without any errors.

Tried on STOPPED SC,
{noformat}
[root@c-26 .euca4restart]# euca-modify-service -s STOPPED SC_61
RESPONSE true
[root@c-26 .euca4restart]# euca-describe-services | grep SC
SERVICE	storage        	PARTI00        	SC_61          	STOPPED   	83  	http://10.111.1.61:8773/services/Storage	arn:euca:eucalyptus:PARTI00:storage:SC_61/
SERVICE	storage        	PARTI00        	SC_69          	DISABLED  	83  	http://10.111.1.69:8773/services/Storage	arn:euca:eucalyptus:PARTI00:storage:SC_69/
[root@c-26 .euca4restart]# euca-describe-services | grep SC
SERVICE	storage        	PARTI00        	SC_61          	STOPPED   	83  	http://10.111.1.61:8773/services/Storage	arn:euca:eucalyptus:PARTI00:storage:SC_61/
SERVICE	storage        	PARTI00        	SC_69          	ENABLED   	83  	http://10.111.1.69:8773/services/Storage	arn:euca:eucalyptus:PARTI00:storage:SC_69/
[root@c-26 .euca4restart]# euca-modify-service -s DISABLED SC_61
RESPONSE true
[root@c-26 .euca4restart]# euca-describe-services | grep SC
SERVICE	storage        	PARTI00        	SC_61          	DISABLED  	84  	http://10.111.1.61:8773/services/Storage	arn:euca:eucalyptus:PARTI00:storage:SC_61/
SERVICE	storage        	PARTI00        	SC_69          	NOTREADY  	84  	http://10.111.1.69:8773/services/Storage	arn:euca:eucalyptus:PARTI00:storage:SC_69/
{noformat}
(the NOTREADY SC eventually goes to DISABLED->ENABLED state after few seconds)

Tried on ENABLED SC,
{noformat}
[root@c-26 .euca4restart]# euca-describe-services | grep SC
SERVICE	storage        	PARTI00        	SC_61          	DISABLED  	85  	http://10.111.1.61:8773/services/Storage	arn:euca:eucalyptus:PARTI00:storage:SC_61/
SERVICE	storage        	PARTI00        	SC_69          	ENABLED   	85  	http://10.111.1.69:8773/services/Storage	arn:euca:eucalyptus:PARTI00:storage:SC_69/
[root@c-26 .euca4restart]# euca-modify-service -s DISABLED SC_69
RESPONSE true
[root@c-26 .euca4restart]# euca-describe-services | grep SC
SERVICE	storage        	PARTI00        	SC_61          	DISABLED  	87  	http://10.111.1.61:8773/services/Storage	arn:euca:eucalyptus:PARTI00:storage:SC_61/
SERVICE	storage        	PARTI00        	SC_69          	DISABLED  	87  	http://10.111.1.69:8773/services/Storage	arn:euca:eucalyptus:PARTI00:storage:SC_69/
[root@c-26 .euca4restart]# euca-describe-services | grep SC
SERVICE	storage        	PARTI00        	SC_61          	ENABLED   	87  	http://10.111.1.61:8773/services/Storage	arn:euca:eucalyptus:PARTI00:storage:SC_61/
SERVICE	storage        	PARTI00        	SC_69          	DISABLED  	87  	http://10.111.1.69:8773/services/Storage	arn:euca:eucalyptus:PARTI00:storage:SC_69/
{noformat}

Tried state transition almost in the same time,
{noformat}
[root@c-26 .euca4restart]# euca-modify-service -s STOPPED SC_61 ; euca-modify-service -s ENABLED SC_69 ; euca-modify-service -s DISABLED SC_61
RESPONSE true
RESPONSE true
RESPONSE true
{noformat}
